dynamic_webform.datamodels package¶

Submodules¶

dynamic_webform.datamodels.local_store module¶

class dynamic_webform.datamodels.local_store.ParquetLocalDataStore¶

Bases: object

(Deprecated) Datastore class to handle data storage as a local Parquet file.

append_or_update_data_to_local_store(data, config, format='parquet')¶

(Deprecated) Handle an UPSERT operation into local store data.

This method defines UPSERT behavior of a new record, called ‘data’, into the local store of the specified data type. The current behavior is an Session ID-based UPSERT; if a row with the new record’s session_id value exists, it is completely overwritten with the new data; otherwise, the row is inserted into the datastore

Parameters:

  • data – A dict that stores form responses and session information

  • format – (optional, default=’parquet’) The format of the datastore. Only ‘parquet’ is currently supported.

Returns:

None

read_local_store_data(config)¶

(Deprecated) Read data from the local datastore and return it as a Pandas DataFrame.

Parameters:

None

Returns:

A Pandas DataFrame containing all data from the local datastore.

dynamic_webform.datamodels.managers module¶

class dynamic_webform.datamodels.managers.BaseDatastoreManager¶

Bases: object

Abstract base class for Datastore Managers. All datastore managers must broker initial setup, connection establishment, checks and teardowns as well as required data IUD operations transparently, with the same high-level functions (see methods below). This is to maintain code readability and ease of use.

add_bulk_data()¶

Bulk data INSERT functionality, usually from an uploaded file. Consider making this UPSERT by default.

add_data()¶

Data INSERT functionality; consider making this UPSERT by default.

check_connection()¶

If applicable, handle any heartbeats/connection pool refreshes here.

delete_data()¶

Data DELETE functionality. Consider disabling unless required.

read_data()¶

Return data as a manipulatable object (usually a Pandas Dataframe)

refresh()¶

If applicable, rebuild the state of the datastore (or any views of the state).

class dynamic_webform.datamodels.managers.DatastoreManager(app, config)¶

Bases: BaseDatastoreManager

Main datastore-managing class that currently handles the following datastores: [mysql]

add_bulk_data(bulk_upload_data)¶

Bulk data INSERT operation, implements UPSERT logic.

Parameters:

  • bulk_upload_data (pd.DataFrame) – A Pandas DataFrame containing multiple rows of data meant to be

  • datastore. (UPSERTED into the)

Returns:

None

add_data(submission_data)¶

Data INSERT operation, implements UPSERT logic.

Parameters:

submission_data (dict) – A dict containing JSON-equivalent form submission information.

Returns:

None

read_data(id=None)¶

A query interface into the datastore; an optional ID controls if a specific row or all rows are returned.

Parameters:

id (str) – A session_id value to look up in the datastore. If blank, all results are returned.

refresh()¶

Refresh the form table schema (migrations handled with Alembic)

dynamic_webform.datamodels.mysql module¶

class dynamic_webform.datamodels.mysql.MySQLDatastore(app, config)¶

Bases: object

SQLAlchemy-interfaced, ORM-bound MySQL Datastore class. Implements low-level data operations on a configured MySQL instance.

app¶

The Flask app implementing this Datastore instance.

Type:

Flask

db¶

The Flask-SQLAlchemy instance used to perform ORM-bound operations

Type:

SQLAlchemy

config¶

The full contents of the config.yaml configuration file

Type:

dict

table_name¶

The name of the table that will contain form submission data (from config)

Type:

str

table_model¶

A SQLAlchemy model of the table, generated at runtime using the form_config Excel sheet

Type:

db.Model

migrate¶

An Alembic Migrate object used to initialize and govern migrations (changes in schema)

Type:

Migrate

logger¶

A singleton logger instance for logging.

Type:

LoggerManager

sqlalchemy_database_uri¶

A SQLAlchemy URI generated using the config and added to the app dictionary

engine¶

A SQLAlchemy ORM Engine to handle specific low-level data operations

check_connection()¶

‘Check’ the existing connection associated with this Datastore instance by opening and closing the configured connection.

create_engine()¶

Create a SQLAlchemy engine to handle low-level data operations (IUD)

generate_database_uri_from_config(mysql_config_params)¶

Helper function to cleanly generate a MySQL-specific SQLAlchemy Database URI for the app dictionary.

Parameters:

mysql_config_params (dict) – A subset of MySQL-specific configuration parameters from the config.yaml file

Returns:

A formatted SQLAlchemy database URI.

Return type:

SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URI(str)

generate_table_orm_from_config_file(config_folder='formbuilder', config_filename='wny_config.xlsx')¶

Generates an Object-Relational Mapper (ORM) that is an object representation of the actual database table. Generated dynamically using the form_config Excel sheet, and is used to control data operations on the underlying table.

Parameters:

  • config_folder (str) – (Optional, default=’formbuilder’) The name of the folder, under the config/ directory, containing the form_config Excel sheet.

  • config_filename (str) – (Optional, default=’wny_config.xlsx’) The name of the actual Excel file containing form configuration information. Essentially controls the schema of the database table and ORM,

Returns:

A SQLAlchemy db.Model instance (ORM)

query(id=None)¶

Query the MySQL database associated with this Datastore instance; return all rows or a specific one using an ID if provided.

Parameters:

id (str) – (Optional) An optional session_id value to look up in the underlying MySQL database.

Returns:

A Pandas DataFrame object containing query results.

upsert_bulk_data(bulk_upload_data)¶

Perform a bulk UPSERT (UPDATE rows with the same session_ids as the submission data, INSERT if such rows do not exist). Also ensure that the ‘id’ and ‘timestamp’ fields are added to the data if they do not already exist. The ‘id’ and ‘timestamp’ fields are not case-sensitive but must be included if updating existing data.

Parameters:

bulk_upload_data (pd.DataFrame) – A Pandas DataFrame that contains several instances (rows) of form submission data.

Returns:

None

upsert_data(submission_data)¶

Perform an UPSERT (UPDATE row with the same session_id as the submission data, INSERT if such a row does not exist) against the data in the database using the provided submission data.

Parameters:

submission_data (dict) – A JSON-equivalent dict containing form submission information.

Returns:

None
